intro: Chrysothamnus monocephala, commonly known as the single-head goldenbush, is a perennial shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, yellow-green foliage and produces yellow flowers in late summer. The plant has a compact growth habit with multiple stems that often branch near the base. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant in arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for erosion control and wildlife habitat.
